document_data.name: Pus-chuts-otes
document_data.mainbody: '''Pus-chuts-otes''', which translated into "sticky ground", was a religious ritual observed by the [[Azuposi]] people of the [[Pasocada Basin]] of northern [[Maztica]].
document_data.Activities: This ritual was performed by a [[sunwatcher]] when the crops needed to be planted. The [[priest]] determined the exact time of year to perform the ritual by carefully monitoring the sun in relation to specific landmarks.
